p: Figure 12 shows the evolution of the antioxidant activity of the strawberries, with each of the treatments. As can be observed, during day 15 of storage, the percentage of inhibition of the ABTSÂ°+ radical was higher in the fruits with the incorporation of Thymus capitatus (T2, T3, and T4) compared to the control (T1). As shown in Figure 11, the percentage of inhibition reached values of 14.57, 23.29, 23.50, 18.93, and 13.93 for T1, T2, T3, T4, and T5, respectively, at the end of the test.
